query: Management of hypertension not including ACE inhibitors

documents.text: Lifestyle modifications like reducing sodium intake and increasing physical activity are key strategies for controlling blood pressure in hypertensive patients.
Thiazide diuretics are often prescribed to manage mild to moderate hypertension, particularly in elderly individuals or those with salt sensitivity.
ACE inhibitors such as lisinopril are commonly used for treating hypertension due to their kidney-protective effects, especially in diabetic patients.
Ramipril, an ACE inhibitor, is effective in reducing blood pressure and preventing cardiovascular events in high-risk patients.
Combination therapy involving ACE inhibitors and calcium channel blockers can help achieve blood pressure targets in resistant hypertension.
Patients with proteinuric kidney disease benefit from ACE inhibitor therapy to reduce glomerular pressure and proteinuria.

query: Preventing migraines without using triptans

documents.text: Magnesium supplements and riboflavin are effective natural approaches to reducing the frequency of migraine attacks.
Cognitive behavioral therapy can reduce migraine frequency by managing stress and sleep disturbances that often trigger headaches.
Triptans like sumatriptan and rizatriptan provide effective relief from acute migraine episodes by targeting serotonin receptors.
Patients who experience migraines with aura often respond well to triptan therapy when taken at the earliest sign of symptoms.
Triptans are the mainstay of abortive migraine therapy due to their ability to constrict dilated blood vessels in the brain.
Triptans remain the preferred treatment for moderate to severe migraines in patients without cardiovascular risk factors.

query: COPD treatment excluding bronchodilators

documents.text: Pulmonary rehabilitation programs have been shown to improve exercise tolerance and reduce dyspnea in COPD patients.
Vaccination against influenza and pneumococcus is essential to prevent COPD exacerbations.
Bronchodilators such as salbutamol and tiotropium are used to reduce airflow limitation and improve quality of life.
Long-acting bronchodilators play a pivotal role in maintenance therapy for moderate to severe COPD.
Combination inhalers containing LABA and LAMA bronchodilators are preferred for advanced COPD cases.
Bronchodilators are cornerstone medications in all GOLD-defined stages of COPD severity.

query: Pain management in osteoarthritis not involving NSAIDs

documents.text: Topical capsaicin and physiotherapy provide safe and effective relief in early-stage knee osteoarthritis.
Hyaluronic acid injections are used for patients who are not suitable candidates for NSAIDs or surgery.
Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) like ibuprofen and naproxen are routinely used to reduce osteoarthritic pain.
NSAID use is associated with gastrointestinal and renal risks, particularly in elderly osteoarthritis patients.
Diclofenac gel, a topical NSAID, offers localized pain relief with fewer systemic side effects.
Long-term NSAID therapy must be monitored for adverse effects such as peptic ulcers and elevated creatinine.

query: Treatment of depression not including SSRIs

documents.text: Cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) is a first-line non-pharmacological intervention for mild to moderate depression.
Bupropion, an atypical antidepressant, is commonly used for patients experiencing fatigue and lack of motivation.
SSRIs such as sertraline and escitalopram are the most frequently prescribed medications for major depressive disorder.
Fluoxetine is an SSRI approved for both adults and adolescents with depressive symptoms and suicidal ideation.
SSRIs work by increasing synaptic serotonin levels and are generally well tolerated by most patients.
Treatment guidelines recommend SSRIs as first-line therapy due to their efficacy and low side effect profile.

query: Management of epilepsy not including valproate

documents.text: Lamotrigine is preferred for patients with focal seizures and has a favorable cognitive and behavioral profile.
Levetiracetam is effective for generalized seizures and often chosen for its minimal drug interactions.
Valproate is a broad-spectrum antiepileptic drug commonly used for generalized seizures and myoclonic epilepsy.
Women of childbearing age are advised to avoid valproate due to its teratogenic effects despite its efficacy.
Valproate increases GABA levels and stabilizes neuronal firing in various epilepsy subtypes.
Valproate remains a mainstay treatment for patients with absence seizures and primary generalized epilepsy.

query: Osteoporosis treatment excluding bisphosphonates

documents.text: Daily intake of calcium and vitamin D plays a foundational role in maintaining bone density in osteoporosis patients.
Teriparatide, a recombinant parathyroid hormone, stimulates bone formation and is used in severe osteoporosis cases.
Alendronate and risedronate, both bisphosphonates, are widely prescribed to slow bone loss and reduce fracture risk.
Zoledronic acid, a potent bisphosphonate, is administered annually via IV to manage postmenopausal osteoporosis.
Bisphosphonates work by inhibiting osteoclast-mediated bone resorption and are first-line agents for most patients.
Use of bisphosphonates significantly reduces the incidence of hip and vertebral fractures in elderly women.

query: Treatment of type 2 diabetes not including insulin therapy

documents.text: Metformin remains the first-line pharmacologic treatment for type 2 diabetes, particularly effective in reducing hepatic glucose production.
SGLT2 inhibitors offer cardiovascular and renal benefits for type 2 diabetic patients beyond just glycemic control.
Long-acting insulin analogs are frequently initiated when oral antidiabetic medications fail to maintain target HbA1c levels.
Basal insulin therapy plays a critical role in restoring fasting glycemia in patients with long-standing type 2 diabetes.
Insulin pens improve adherence in patients needing multiple daily injections to manage type 2 diabetes effectively.
Adding insulin therapy becomes necessary in patients with beta-cell exhaustion where oral agents are insufficient.

query: Managing chronic constipation not including laxatives

documents.text: Increased dietary fiber intake and fluid consumption help in softening stool and promoting regular bowel movements.
Pelvic floor physical therapy is beneficial for patients with dyssynergic defecation contributing to chronic constipation.
Osmotic laxatives like polyethylene glycol are often used for chronic idiopathic constipation.
Stimulant laxatives such as senna or bisacodyl act directly on the intestinal wall to induce bowel movements.
Laxatives are frequently prescribed for opioid-induced constipation in palliative care settings.
Chronic use of laxatives should be monitored due to risk of dependency and electrolyte imbalance.

query: Preventing stroke not including anticoagulants

documents.text: Controlling blood pressure remains the most important modifiable factor in preventing ischemic and hemorrhagic strokes.
Smoking cessation and physical activity are essential lifestyle interventions to reduce stroke risk.
Anticoagulants like warfarin or apixaban are commonly used to prevent cardioembolic stroke in atrial fibrillation patients.
Long-term anticoagulation is recommended for secondary stroke prevention in patients with mechanical heart valves.
Direct oral anticoagulants (DOACs) have replaced warfarin in many stroke prevention protocols.
Use of anticoagulants in stroke prevention requires regular monitoring of renal function and bleeding risk.

query: Chronic pain relief excluding opioids and gabapentin

documents.text: Transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation (TENS) is a non-pharmacologic method that may reduce chronic pain in musculoskeletal conditions.
Mindfulness-based stress reduction techniques can help modulate pain perception in patients with fibromyalgia.
Opioids remain widely prescribed for severe chronic pain despite concerns about dependency and overdose.
Gabapentin is frequently used for neuropathic pain and fibromyalgia, though it may cause sedation in some patients.

query: Type 1 diabetes management not involving insulin or sulfonylureas

documents.text: Continuous glucose monitoring and carbohydrate counting are essential parts of type 1 diabetes self-management education.
Low glycemic index diets may improve glucose stability in patients with insulin-independent strategies.
Insulin therapy is essential in type 1 diabetes due to the complete absence of endogenous insulin production.
Some sulfonylureas stimulate residual beta cell activity in neonatal diabetes but are ineffective for most type 1 cases.

query: Antiviral therapy for hepatitis C without interferon or ribavirin

documents.text: Direct-acting antivirals (DAAs) have revolutionized hepatitis C treatment with cure rates above 95% and fewer side effects.
Sofosbuvir-based regimens target HCV RNA polymerase and are well tolerated across multiple genotypes.
Ribavirin is sometimes added to interferon-based regimens to enhance response, though side effects are common.
Interferon injections were previously the standard of care for hepatitis C before DAAs became widely available.

query: Psoriasis treatment not treated with methotrexate or biologics

documents.text: Topical corticosteroids and vitamin D analogues remain first-line therapies for mild plaque psoriasis.
Phototherapy using narrowband UVB can be an effective option for widespread but stable psoriatic lesions.
Methotrexate is a systemic immunosuppressant used in moderate-to-severe psoriasis, often requiring liver function monitoring.
Biologic agents like adalimumab and secukinumab target specific immune pathways in moderate to severe plaque psoriasis.

query: Treating anxiety disorders apart from SSRIs and benzodiazepines

documents.text: Cognitive behavioral therapy is one of the most effective non-drug treatments for generalized anxiety disorder.
Buspirone is an anxiolytic with fewer sedative effects, especially useful for long-term management of chronic anxiety.
SSRIs like paroxetine and sertraline are first-line pharmacologic agents for social anxiety disorder and panic disorder.
Benzodiazepines such as lorazepam are often prescribed for acute anxiety episodes but have risk of dependence.

query: Breast cancer treatment excluding chemotherapy and tamoxifen

documents.text: Targeted therapy with HER2 inhibitors such as trastuzumab is effective for HER2-positive breast cancers.
Surgical removal of the tumor followed by radiotherapy remains a standard approach in localized breast cancer.
Tamoxifen is a selective estrogen receptor modulator widely used in hormone receptor-positive breast cancer.
Adjuvant chemotherapy is used to eliminate micrometastases and reduce recurrence risk in early-stage disease.

query: Rheumatoid arthritis therapy avoiding DMARDs and corticosteroids

documents.text: Physical therapy and joint-friendly exercise routines help maintain function in rheumatoid arthritis patients.
Omega-3 fatty acids and turmeric supplements have shown modest symptom improvement in autoimmune conditions.
DMARDs like methotrexate are foundational therapies in halting progression of rheumatoid arthritis.
Short courses of corticosteroids are commonly used for RA flares due to their rapid anti-inflammatory effects.

query: Managing high cholesterol not including statins or ezetimibe

documents.text: Dietary changes such as reducing saturated fat intake and increasing soluble fiber can significantly lower LDL levels.
Regular aerobic exercise helps raise HDL cholesterol and improve overall cardiovascular risk profile.
Statins are the most effective lipid-lowering agents for reducing cardiovascular events in high-risk patients.
Ezetimibe works by inhibiting cholesterol absorption in the intestines and is often combined with statins.

query: Treatment of bacterial pneumonia other than macrolides and fluoroquinolones

documents.text: Beta-lactam antibiotics such as amoxicillin-clavulanate are effective against Streptococcus pneumoniae.
Ceftriaxone is a commonly used cephalosporin for inpatient treatment of community-acquired pneumonia.
Macrolides like azithromycin are used for atypical pneumonia due to their intracellular penetration.
Fluoroquinolones such as levofloxacin offer broad-spectrum coverage but carry risks of tendon injury.

query: Managing GERD without PPIs and H2 blockers

documents.text: Elevating the head of the bed and avoiding large meals before bedtime can reduce nocturnal GERD symptoms.
Weight loss in overweight patients significantly improves GERD-related symptoms and esophageal acid exposure.
Proton pump inhibitors (PPIs) like omeprazole are the mainstay of treatment for erosive esophagitis.
H2 receptor blockers such as ranitidine and famotidine reduce acid secretion by blocking histamine receptors.
